intro: Sugerokia leucantha, commonly known as the white sugarkiss, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a fuzzy texture. Sugerokia leucantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
